frameDefinitions: A Communicator announces (linguistically or non-linguistically) the  imminent arrival of an Individual or the occurrence of an Event.

The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee).  '' 'We asked Ruby what kind of food they ate.'
A person (Speaker) expresses a Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular Manner.
This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
A Protester (or Protesters) expresses a strong opinion either in support of or against an Issue, or the Action(s) of a Side which relate to the Issue.
frameExamples: The unveiling of Alinghi's keel was <t>heralded</t> by alp horns
We <t>asked</t> Ruby what kind of food they ate.
On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
Lionel Hutz <t>coated</t> the wall with paint.
Several hundred Tibetans, already worried by inflation, took to the streets to <t>protest</t> at the new measures.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Communicator</fen> greets the arrival of an <fen>Individual</fen> or occurrence of an <fen>Event</fen>.
The person who is greeted at their arrival by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The occurrence which is greeted by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The symbol-containing artifact whereby a <fen>Communicator</fen> heralds.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Communicator</fen>  heralds.
This role identifies the place where the Communicator heralds.
The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets:

The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb.  However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive :
The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target:
Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The time at which the questioning occurs.
<fen>Speaker</fen>, the person who encodes the <fen>Message</fen>, occurs as the External Argument of all the verbs:
The <fen>Message</fen> is almost invariably expressed in an NP Object. (The only exceptions occur with the verb <t>express</t>, which is occasionally used with that-clause complements.)

For most of the words in this frame, some expression of <fen>Manner</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> is obligatory. As in other frames, <fen>Manner</fen> expressions characterize the action (in this case, the speech act performed by the <fen>Speaker</fen>). However, a wide range of <fen>Manner</fen> expressions occurs in this frame, including the following types:
<fen>Medium</fen> expresses the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication, such as the language used or the specific type of text in which the <fen>Message</fen> occurs:
The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the actor who instigates the filling.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the physical object or substance which changes location.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame.
An event which brings about the filling of the <fen>Goal</fen>.
When the filling occurs.
Where the filling takes place.
The individual (or individuals) who holds an opinion on an Issue or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Protester</fen> has an positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Protester</fen> sides with.
An action taken by a Side or a view that the Side takes on an issue which the <fen>Protester</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the Protesters express their opinions.
The location where the <fen>Protester</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
listRoleExamples: Sheep scattered from the road as trumpets heralded <fex>his arrival at the castle gates</fex>
<fex>Pat</fex> quizzed me about where I had been.
Pat questioned <fex>me</fex> about where I had been.
<fex>'What are you doing?'</fex> Kim inquired.
Pat inquired <fex>about train times</fex>.
I inquired <fex>yesterday</fex>.
<fex>The teacher</fex> phrased the question carefully.
The Prime Minister expressed <fex>her sympathy for the victims</fex>.
True Manner: You should phrase it <fex>carefully</fex>.
Kim formulated her objections <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>The voters</fex> elected Blair.
The students overthrew <fex>the president</fex>.
The president appoints <fex>the prime minister</fex>.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
The rebels overthrew <fex>the dictatorship</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.
Rev. Lovejoy carefully brushed the rolls <fex>with butter</fex>.
On 8 May a <fex>student</fex> demonstration was attended by a large number of workers.
Hundreds gathered this afternoon to demonsrate <fex>for women's rights</fex>.
Violent protests <fex>against the government</fex> are sure to break out.
Several hundred Tibetans, already worried by inflation, took to the streets to protest <fex>at the new measures</fex>.
